sourceMeaningMnemonic: Jump on a <radical>scooter</radical> to <radical>excuse</radical> yourself from answering a question and you've successfully <kanji>deviate</kanji>d from that nosey person's plan! You've also been able to <kanji>elude</kanji> them pretty well.
meaningInfo: Imagine excusing yourself by scooting away on a scooter. If they want to get your answer, they'll have to chase you.
readingMnemonic: You <kanji>deviate</kanji> from the plan a little too well, and as you're scooting, what you've done <reading>eats</reading> (<ja>いつ</ja>) away at you. You feel guilty for eluding them...
readingInfo: Welp, it's too late to turn back now. You've already deviated pretty far, and you're not even sure where you are now. You were too busy trying to elude that person that you didn't look where your scooter was taking you.
